text: Christy Marx is an American scriptwriter, author, and game designer. She has written on many television series, for example, Jem, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Conan the Adventurer, G.I. Joe, Hypernauts, and Captain Power. She is also known for her work on comic books. She made a comic book series known as Sisterhood of Steel. She has also worked on Conan, Red Sonja, and Elfquest. Marx has written many biographies and books about history. == Career == The Red Sonja comic series has of some of the earliest comics Marx has shown to the public. The first video game she worked on was Conquests of Camelot in 1990. She worked as a writer and designer. She also worked on the sequel Conquests of the Longbow. She started working at Zynga in late 2010. She worked on Hidden Chronicles and other games. She stopped working at Zynga in 2017.Interview: The creator of the Conquests adventures on what made them special She wrote the character Amethyst, Princess of Gemworld in the 2012 comic series Sword of Sorcery. The series was based on an earlier comic series with the same name. It was released in August 2013. She also wrote a guide for writing, Writing for Animation, Comics, and Games. == Personal life == Marx's first husband, Peter Ledger. was an illustrator. His art is in the computer game Conquests of Camelot and the graphic novel Sisterhood of Steel. == Awards == * Marx won the Animation Writers Caucus Animation Award from the Writers Guild of America in 2000. She won the award for her work in animation writing. * Best Computer Adventure game 1990, by Video Games and Computer Entertainment Magazine, for Conquests of Camelot: The Search for the Holy Grail * Best Adventure game 1991, by Computer Game Review and Enchanted Realms, for Conquests of the Longbow: The Legend of Robin Hood * Marx was part of the team that won a 2006 Distinguished Achievement Award from the Association of Educational Publishers.
